document.title: EMPIRE STATE INFORMATION FLUENCY CONTINUUM Priority Skills: Grades 6-8

AC7B9AD23A484C7095B5476119C7881A.description: Takes a leadership role in collaborative groups

E87B8DFB4D8E414CBB9C7185C78DCB60.description:
Displays self-confidence in forming and sharing own opinion and ideas (even when those ideas are different from or conflict with the
ideas of others), but also in changing ideas when appropriate

7A955588146B4295AC151D7BF1495AD0.description: Develops aspects of personal identity that are the most satisfying, identity-confirming, and culturally responsive

20E3AEFD541D4532AC25E9B655E22174.description: Exhibits effective skills in sharing knowledge gained through personal and academic pursuits

D15652CE20CB465C9E2330E97060F673.description: Information-fluent learners develop agency (personal identity and confidence) to express their ideas, raise awareness, advocate for change, and/or take social action.

ABE0BE79CAA941A1A733C478475972E6.description:
Displays resilience by pursuing alternative decisions or actions after failing or receiving negative feedback and learning from that failure
[responsible decision-making]

9160B04031594592858258AAFB4DAADF.description: Develops a growth mindset by identifying own strengths and preferences in terms of future career [self-awareness]

E74BA8CCB6D1478FB392E8FF7AF160E9.description:
Empathizes with literary characters, peers, people in the local and global community, and social issues by placing them in historical or
social context [social awareness]

5CFBDE1ABF9640F2805D5A907BD29D29.description: Demonstrates respect for diverse people and perspectives [social awareness]

F5166881AF7E4A7CB3EC3A8DA993AA4B.description: Builds trusting relationship with diverse peers and adults through collaboration and communication [relationship skills]

B80611771BE24CA1AFC393D08DD356FD.description: Explores opportunities to prepare for the future, including higher education, career training, vocational training

0EACEEB476E44E64AE8C351C47644249.description: Selects print and nonprint materials based on personal interests, knowledge of authors, and reading level

F877B1A3EB0B4BA09CB408F746509E36.description: Sets reading goals and reads independently

640D68C18CF84F65BF20000F32A95098.description: Personal Exploration and Independent Reading and Learning

4C670FBCDEBE49EF86309CA6E467F25D.description: Information-fluent learners use information and ideas presented in any format to reflect on and pursue personal interests, develop strengths, and engage in personalized and independent learning.

B9460F2F5717414A95DC35D0AAED97B2.description: Personal Growth and Agency: Engage in Personal Exploration, Social and Emotional Growth, Independent Reading and Learning, and Personal Agency

07033A18DBE2420EB560D3F984FEC723.description: Observes Internet safety procedures, including safeguarding personal information and equipment

BE9209F2051D48F9A31BB6BEDD0B3C2D.description: Demonstrates understanding of a digital footprint and constructs own footprint accordingly

8D11E3776107491E9278021FEA47D6EE.description: Checks the validity of all information and avoids the spread of misinformation on social media

77DACF3168664DD182097351F84343D0.description: Abides by the Acceptable Use Policy by accessing only appropriate information and using technology responsibly

C55106EA16204DD999B84A0BAA715A36.description: Safe and Ethical Use of Technology

31C8864648E846978D91D13FC0A24D1E.description:
Makes ethical decisions about the creation and sharing of information (e.g., respecting rights of creators, remixing, and using images and
print within the guidelines of Fair Use)

A1C2DB4CABEA49538198844D10164B41.description: Information-fluent learners demonstrate digital citizenship by maintaining ethical decision making and behavior and avoiding the spread of misinformation in the exchange and use of information.

8F575853E9BB49D09C0A09A3EF987E6D.description:
Works collaboratively to develop, publish, and present projects involving 1-2 media that effectively communicate information and ideas
about the curriculum to authentic audiences

9A2202305020418A8A5A80C5360144F7.description: Engages effectively in collaborative discussions with diverse groups

6C812D78C18A416B99B4DDA0EEAE120E.description: Expresses own ideas clearly and builds on the ideas of others

E5E4FC654843494A9F609D6BA33FF5A5.description: Information-fluent learners demonstrate effective collaboration in the exchange of information, in both the face-to-face and digital environment.

CA874A4A871D47DC823867B61B36D61B.description: Listens carefully to the reasoning and ideas of others, engages in a discussion, and changes own opinion when those ideas have merit

2B3A3037361541AAB0583BC3EF969F1A.description:
Demonstrates respect for the principles of equitable access to information by curating and sharing valid and authoritative sources with
classmates

92EF8215AE484875A9C0833E42C42A70.description: Expresses own opinion in an appropriate manner, even when the opinion differs from the ideas of others

7D033051C9E84A96A83D8C6F9C50B164.description:
Demonstrates critical evaluation strategies that are appropriate for various types of sources (e.g., authoritative websites, fringe or fake
websites, blogs, tweets, viral videos)

AE7E8F52649F493D8A847C8D6AA18E91.description:
Identifies and challenges misinformation and own assumptions about community issues and diverse cultures by seeking and evaluating
multiple viewpoints and cultural perspectives

AD7CBCB98E384E2CB8AC42F789BF826D.description: Evaluates and compares the authority, credibility, accuracy (by fact-checking), and point of view of all sources of information

E7A359AB3AAE4F47AE59E00DBF0FEBCA.description: Learning from Diverse and Credible Points of View

AD86A11EF7DA4282B5D6E7C97BA68DEF.description: Information-fluent learners recognize the importance of accurate information to a democratic society and actively seek, evaluate, learn from, and use credible information from diverse community and global perspectives.

E6B2615B405348CB8D63F1CC2118BAD0.description: Social and Civic Responsibility: Demonstrate Civic Responsibility, Respect for Diverse Perspectives, Collaboration, and Digital Citizenship

E345EEE8C01E4B83A670DD02EDB3FD16.description: Matches language of presentation with audience, purpose, complexity of the content, and intended impact

9EC08138B834466584484CFACF34B46E.description:
Uses the language of the medium (e.g., use of color, pace, perspective, visuals) and the characteristics of the technology tool to create
and deliver an effective presentation

7C12ECA4A7D2447D89A9866F0EE8BD86.description: Determines the purpose and intended audience of a media presentation

34C46D27862D415D8F41E3844A79CE2A.description: Develops the skills of public speaking (e.g., clear delivery, eye contact, body language, voice, pace)

F264360EFCD645C1BF8A1C8E34119C59.description: Information-fluent learners present their learning and ideas by constructing messages using multiple, authentic formats appropriate for the purpose and audience.

B260D4D5074D47ABACD2443849EF87A2.description:
Deconstructs media claims and arguments by looking at logical fallacies, persuasive techniques, and the use of the language of the
medium (e.g., use of color, pace, perspective, narrative structure, visuals)

DC64B10973A24CEB82363BD83499FF39.description: Evaluates the impact of media by looking the use of the language of the medium (e.g., use of color, pace, perspective, visuals)

995DCAD941E34803B7F16FF18E54E46E.description: Analyzes visual text (e.g., charts, graphs, photographs, videos, timelines, maps) to gather information and draw inferences about meaning

2611240A93244126A2D8A99CA793C882.description: Participates in literary discussions, special literary programs, and book clubs

D7664C2F67994404B80B891D37C16206.description: Information-fluent learners use multimedia literacy skills and knowledge to deconstruct and learn from texts in multiple formats through comprehension, analysis, interpretation, and evaluation.

6FC86FA2F39140C7BBB173E5124869C7.description: Multiple Literacies: Use Multiple Literacies to Explore, Learn, and Express Ideas

51B18AA33C764BD6BEDD2CB219C5A456.description:
Engages actively in a design process to use tools, resources, and materials to test the hypothesis or desired result by creating a solution or
model, testing the results, modifying the model when needed, and determining the validity of the hypothesis or the quality of the model

F8BA941D738C41AA84042F197310E32B.description:
Builds on real-world experiences to broaden perspective and open creative possibilities (e.g., field trips, makerspaces, coding, video and
audio production)

51DB62A602FA4DC9AA3DE8E8436FC511.description:
Selects and uses resources and technology to investigate identified problems through active experimentation, experience, creation, and
engagement

7A3A91D2886B410D998F264ACCA77E45.description: Information-fluent learners experience, experiment, and use a design process to discover creative solutions to authentic problems, form personal understandings, and propose original ideas.

3CD795FD285B46FB8925AA161E39CD85.description: Identifies own strengths (academic, social, and emotional) and sets goals for improvement

7338F76498E64EE5939BA4280537AEEA.description: Reflects on own emotional and intellectual experience through the process of inquiry

2D2C2BA4DFE54969B82D6C7810C31DE9.description: Identifies and evaluates the importance of features for a good product, presentation, and engagement in the process of inquiry

C07DFB5371A44A26A56AECC92A096E21.description: Cites all sources used according to local style formats

1B2377A883144863A9528D2690A167B0.description: Creates products for authentic reasons and audiences

673E6160DCA14F2297FBE3A703E78115.description: Presents conclusions and supporting facts in a variety of ways

B9E473AE8ABC4FA4B6F923E2AACDAB7C.description:
Develops a line of argument or claim with a line of reasoning, clear supporting evidence, and attention to refuting counter arguments and
claims

F655A74150FB41AE8D8983E8C22A9491.description: Forms opinions, judgments, and claims backed up by supporting evidence and clear reasoning

F5194E0D0B2A47788C80C567B0736138.description: Combines information and weighs evidence to draw conclusions and create meaning

F168664DF0784F35B91435682A31DBD9.description: Interprets information and ideas by defining, classifying, and inferring

8DCCD3A1EC6941DD9BA5393FE6BA3482.description:
Uses common organizational patterns (e.g., chronological order, cause and effect, compare/contrast) to organize information in order to
draw conclusion

C49C5B83A1AF4C458208ACD8E52D4CB8.description:
Employs reflective notetaking strategies to capture own thinking and inferences about the evidence being noted in words and phrases,
summarized, paraphrased, or quoted

C0AFB59791A6421FBBCA46B8B3470571.description:
Takes notes using one or more of a variety of notetaking strategies (e.g., outlining, underlining, bulleted lists, highlighting, graphic
organizers, reflective notetaking)

E9643B0EB1AB4D75804CB8FDB3F5945A.description: Provides evidence for logical inferences based on both the explicit and implicit meaning of text

EE65E9B793654D8B8672DE0C7FD1DE73.description: Identifies misconceptions and revises ideas as new information is gained

6DAE34F956434F3790C828E6CDFC790B.description: Evaluates the development of an argument or claim and the strength of the supporting and refuting evidence provided within the source

B49E2AA3093C485E9209DCC67F7801E7.description: Uses both facts and opinions responsibly by identifying and verifying them

2025365536DF4F3F9D43277EBF090EB2.description: Differentiates between important and unimportant details

E965CD4F449E489B9005F2A9B59B548F.description: Making Sense of Information and Notetaking

A7F377BBDFA0463F9E418DA8CD531FBF.description: Recognizes that own point of view influences the interpretation of information

6948E993CDBC41B9AD087B8428BCCFA2.description:
Evaluates the effect of different perspectives and points of view on information (e.g., why some information is included, why other
information is left out)

BF10A43CF6A947B88F9E38288FBA7C43.description:
Selects high-quality information from multiple sources that answers the research questions, provides a balance of diverse perspectives,
and includes both main ideas and supporting details

8F95F643D8534A04A98A9B6B5083D391.description: Reads laterally in the digital environment to discover divergent and conflicting information as well as corroborating information

9248885869CC406A991AAC027DED70CC.description: Evaluates the accuracy, authority, validity, perspective, and bias of sources and information

1E9984ED422044B7A940C543735DBE3C.description: Fact checks and verifies all information communicated through websites and social media

17E5EF2C487A4B3FACBDC0A0B58360DA.description: Evaluates quality of information within electronic and print sources for usefulness, currency, authority, and accuracy

D7F6B1BD94F54E86A73398220451F06E.description: Selects information from multiple sources that answers the research questions

85D497DFE5044674B6E8DC9A6DEC06D5.description:
Uses different formats (e.g., books, Websites, subscription databases, multimedia, graphs, charts, maps and diagrams) as sources of
information

847944C36C8F43C8AC817A70875FA75F.description: Evaluates, selects, and uses both primary and secondary sources with attention to perspective and comprehensiveness

A7CCC9A9B949461BAC361A719B7A5FA9.description: Uses organizational systems and electronic search strategies (key words, subject headings) to locate appropriate resources

DCD514CB263543D6B1FB3303AA715002.description: Uses the structure and some navigation tools of a Website to find the most relevant information (menu bars, tabs, buttons, sidebars)

B84F59072756412DA5C6FEB939538738.description: Uses online catalog independently to locate specific books, get classification numbers, and browse the shelves

F4A41E0555A7454D8C075B8C883F2FC9.description: Begins to use selected search engines to find appropriate information

324DB5620A3648AF8C7F8F3BB3E042A4.description: Analyzes and evaluates what is known, observed or experienced to form tentative thesis or hypothesis

68304DD0EE18448E9D96AF91DC8FCD4B.description:
Refines questions to guide the search for different types of information (e.g., overview, big-idea, specific detail, cause and effect,
comparison)

9C8037115B96417DBC956033D1CE95EC.description: Writes questions that would lead to an inquiry independently based on key ideas or areas of focus

C0ED96E3D0BC424C81BAE3DB5CDFD211.description:
Assesses questions to determine which can be answered by simple facts, which cannot be answered, and which would lead to an
interesting inquiry

173EF36DA7E249589A13BDD9F5079BAC.description: Revises the topic as needed to arrive at a manageable topic for a given research situation

7E391B945D2640388C3040E4072D70B9.description: Identifies key words and ideas that appear in background information and class conversation

31A5754337B34056B5C034066913A921.description: States and verifies what is known about the problem or question and makes connections to prior knowledge

CDD48664EE2A4995B86C8D774418CC03.description: Information-fluent learners use an inquiry process to connect to prior experience and background knowledge, wonder and ask questions, investigate, construct new understanding, express learning, and reflect on the process and product of learning.

507B8A9F03D64E8498C60C28CDF0EE7D.description: Inquiry and Design Thinking: Use Inquiry and Design Thinking to Build Understanding and Create New Knowledge We are thinkers and designers.
